page.title: 06GOVERNMENT-N CREAKE
page.content: The affairs of the parish are administered by a Parish Council comprised of nine elected members and a paid clerk without voting rights. It operates under the jurisdiction of the West Norfolk District Council, the local authority responsible for all public services in this community. A proportion of the rates collected by the authority is returned to the Parish Council to be spent at local level. The powers of the Parish Council are very limited and although it is able to advise and make recommendations to the district council, the final decisions are always taken at district level. The Parish Council does provide a means by which local residents can raise issues of immediate concern for public discussion and action.
